headline: Hurdles to a Broader Pool of Foster Parents
abstract: Bureaucracy — no surprise — gets in the way of expanding the pool of volunteers.
lead_paragraph: Over the past 15 years or so, Pedro Maldonado, Nigel Warren and Brieanna Hayes, all now in their 20s, cumulatively lived in about 39 different foster homes in New York City. Pedro, who is Italian, was lucky: He ultimately settled in with a caring Mexican family for more than a decade before he aged out of the system and began living on his own.
